docs.lead_paragraph: On the wall of her office at Mount Sinai School of Medicine in New York, Prof. Christine Cassel, 55, has hung an impressionistic still life that a friend painted shortly before dying. ''I keep it there,'' Dr. Cassel said recently, ''to remind myself of all the valiant attempts people make to find meaning at the end of their lives.'' As the head of Mount Sinai's department of geriatrics and adult development, Dr. Cassel spends much of her day seeking new ways for her patients to find meaning and comfort in their final years.

headline.main: Pushing Quality of Life Until the End

docs.abstract: Interview with Dr Christine Cassel, geriatrician at Mount Sinai School of Medicine; she spends much of her day seeking new ways for her patients to find meaning and comfort in their final years; photo (L)
